results.title: Solo
results.brief_description:
Vincent is a cello player and occasional drug dealer. On his way back to Paris he is informed that his brother Virgile is accused of criminal acts perpetrated on behalf of a group of revolutionary students. In a race against time, Vincent decides to get to his runaway brother before the police does.

Credits: Producer, Gilbert Marion ; director, Jean-Pierre Mocky ; writers, Alain Moury, Jean-Pierre Mocky ; photography, Marcel Weiss ; music, Georges Moustaki ; editor, Marguerite Renoir.
Cast: Jean-Pierre Mocky, Sylvie Breal, Anne Deleuze, Denis Le Guillou, Henri Poirier, R. J. Chauffard.

results.title: Solidarity with Sanna
results.brief_description: Finnish Prime Minister Sanna Marin has faced intense media scrutiny and criticism from political opponents since footage of her dancing with friends was leaked on social media. In defiance of the fuss, women in Finland have been sharing videos of themselves partying in solidarity, creating a viral groundswell of support for the world’s youngest head of state. Marin has defended herself publicly against speculation that dancing and drinking in private undermines her professional position. The positive response and support on Twitter and TikTok has effectively turned a negative social media experience – having the video leaked – into one of empowerment.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Finnish Prime Minister Sanna Marin has faced intense media scrutiny and criticism from political opponents since footage of her dancing with friends was leaked on social media. In defiance of the fuss, women in Finland have been sharing videos of themselves partying in solidarity, creating a viral groundswell of support for the world’s youngest head of state. Marin has defended herself publicly against speculation that dancing and drinking in private undermines her professional position. The positive response and support on Twitter and TikTok has effectively turned a negative social media experience – having the video leaked – into one of empowerment.

Marin has defended herself publicly against speculation that dancing and drinking in private undermines her professional position. The positive response and support on Twitter and TikTok has effectively turned a negative social media experience – having the video leaked – into one of empowerment.

results.title: Betty Cuthbert
results.creator_credit: Kathy Mueller, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders, Coote and Carroll and Roadshow Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
This moving drama series on important figures from Australia’s past brings history to life. Betty Cuthbert, the “Golden Girl”, held a very special place in the affections of the sporting world because of her immense courage, optimism and innate modesty. Betty competed in 3 Olympic Games during her 13 year career as the world’s greatest female runner.

results.title: John Norton
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
John Norton was one of Australia’s earliest and most colourful, if not likeable, Press barons. He was an eccentric with a power complex who controlled a chain of newspapers which extended across Australia and New Zealand. Norton was a crusading journalist, the people’s hero, the friend of the working class, but his overwhelming self interest eventually dominated his actions.

results.title: Les Darcy
results.creator_credit: Kevin Dobson, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
Australian boxing hero, Les Darcy, was a legend in his lifetime. In a short but glorious career, Darcy fought fifty fights and won forty-six, and was the Australian Heavyweight Champion in 1916 - he was never knocked out. After fleeing to America to avoid Army enlistment, he became ill and died at the age of 21.

results.title: Soleil Dans L'oeil = Sun in the Eyes (Cinemascope Print)
results.creator_credit: Jacques Bourdon, Andre Deroual and Eric Schlumberger
results.brief_description:
Emma moves to Corsica to work on a translation. Every day she writes to Denis, her lover, who still lives in Paris. She becomes acquainted with Frederic, a local musician and finds herself torn between two lovers.

Credits: Producers, Eric Schlumberger, Andre Deroual ; director, Jacques Bourdon ; writers, Dominique Aury, Eric Schlumberger, Jacques Bourdon ; photography, Lucien Joulin ; music, Maurice Jarre
Cast: Anna Karina, Georges Descrieres, Jacques Perrin, Charles Blavette, Nadine Alari.

results.title: Solaris [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Andrei Tarkovsky, Magna Corporation and Mosfilm
results.brief_description: A psychologist is sent to a spaceship orbiting the planet Solaris to investigate the mysterious disappearances and deaths that have occurred on the ship. He discovers that madness has overtaken the occupants of the craft, who are haunted by the material presence of their guilty past. Soon, the psychologist too finds his past coming back to him in the shape of his dead wife. “Solaris” is an extraordinary science fiction movie that utilises the genre to investigate the increasing alienation and isolation of humanity, a condition accelerated by the rapid advances of technology. The film is ravishing to look at, from its opening shots of a meadow on earth, to the long gliding takes across the surface of the metallic craft. With “Solaris” Tarkovsky established a reputation as the finest Russian film-maker since the days of the silent masters. Along with Kubrick’s “2001”, Tarkovsky’s film is an intelligent and intensely communicated masterwork of science-fiction cinema. From the novel by Stanislaw Lem. Winner of the Special Jury Prize, 1972 Cannes Film Festival.

results.title: Vivian Bullwinkel
results.creator_credit: Ron Hardy, Pamela Vanneck and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
Vivian Bullwinkle was a volunteer nurse during the Second World War. While being evacuated from Singapore the ship on which she was travelling sank. The small group of survivors washed ashore surrendered to the Japanese occupying Banka Island. In a horrific turn of events Japanese troops bayoneted the surviving soldiers and ordered the nurses back into the water. Bullwinkle was shot but miraculously survived. Bleeding and in a state she drifted ashore and hid in the jungle. Discovering a badly wounded British soldier she realised the only chance of survival was to again surrender to the Japanese soldiers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Hardy, Pamela Vanneck and Ron Saunders

results.title: Solar energy
results.brief_description: Investigates the possibility of utilising solar radiation. Shows methods of obtaining heat and electricity from the sun, installations already in operation, production of heat for high temperature and metal research, and the domestic use of solar energy. Gives working Australian examples.
